Sunday, March 21, 2010 - PLAN to ARRIVE EARLY (for seating)
--------------------------------------------------------------------
Boston Vegetarian Society:

4:00 PM - Speaker/Seminar (FREE)
5:15 PM - Vegan Buffet / Social Dinner
Cost: About $12.50 if you tip fairly and generously,
but only about $10.50 if you don't tip at all.

Boston Vegetarian Society Speaker / Dinner Event Sunday, August 19, 2012
What's Wrong with Grass-Fed, Local and Organic Meats?
with speaker Doris Lin, Esq.

Please join BVS for this speaker event!

4 PM - Speaker (FREE)
"What's Wrong with Grass-Fed, Local and Organic Meats?"

We hear about the many problems with factory farming, but what is the solution? Come learn why grass-fed, local or organic meats are not the solution to the problems of factory farming! Doris Lin is an animal rights attorney who holds a B.S. in Applied Biological Sciences from MIT and a J.D. from the University of Southern California Law Center.

She has worked for the Mass. Department of Environmental Protection and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency. 

Doris ALSO writes the New York Times' About.com weekly articles on Animal Rights. 

In addition to her being a great role model for young women, she is the Vice President of Legal Affairs for the Animal Protection League of New Jersey and a member of the Steering Committee of the League of Humane Voters of New Jersey.  Doris Lin is a former BVS Board Member! 

5:15 PM - Social Dinner (optional)

Stay and enjoy Grasshopper's unlimited vegan buffet for only $10.70 + tax + tip
Includes appetizers, soups, salad, and numerous entrees. 
Did you know?
You can top off your Grasshopper buffet with dairy-free ice cream at nearby FoMu,
the new all-vegan ice cream shop just five doors from Grasshopper (towards the new but now widely-advertised Walgreen's.)

ALL WELCOME - No RSVP needed.  Just turnip!

Date and Time: Sunday, August 19, 2012

4 PM - Speaker (FREE)
5:15 PM - Asian Buffet Dinner Location (for seminar and dinner):

Grasshopper (an Asian all-vegan restaurant)
1 North Beacon St., Allston MA 02134 (Boston) 617-254-8883 This is in Union Square, Allston (part of Boston) the intersection of Cambridge St., Brighton Ave., and North Beacon St. 

Buses # 66, 57, and 64 stop there.  Closest subway stop is Allston St. on the Green Line B trolley (Comm. Ave.) Parking:  Free street parking; allow time to find a spot. 

Evelyn Kimber
Boston Vegetarian Society
www.BostonVeg.org
